result.execSummary:
The defendant John Richard Johnson #0062445 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
a) keep DA's office inform address/phone # chg
b) no criminal activity
c) comply & complete success prob in #14 CF 127
d) N/C w/ co-def except Connie Denomie, and then only relating to children
e) absol sob
f) AODA assmt & foll
g) mental health assmt & foll thru
h) success Ashland Co Adult drug ct
i) pay all fin oblig's
j) comply with all cond's of bond
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Consecutive to: 14CF127 and Bayfield County case(s).

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

copy sent to def at ACJ 9/19/17

Defendant John Richard Johnson in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kimberly Lawton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF71 and 14CF127. State req 14CF71 12yr 5IN 7ES, 14CF127 5yr 2IN 3ES CS, comments on sentencing of coactors, comments on Def  sentencing, Spec Pros agrees with PSI, vic rights satisfied. Atty Perrine arguement, clearly prison case, revoked on Bayfield co case IS, sentence(s) should be concurrent to Bayfield co case, 14CF71 rec 7yr 3IN 4ES, 14CF127 2yr 1IN 1ES, CC and concurrent with Bayfield co case. Spec Pros disagrees beleives should be CS. Atty Perrine 14CF127 568 CTS, 14CF71 at least 436CTS plus initial confinement, has requested cts info from the jail but does not have it at this time, argues for lesser period of incarceration. Parties agree to 568 days CTS. Def comments. 
Ct comments. Orders 14CF71 12yrs 5IN 7ES, 14CF127 5yrs 2IN 3ES CS to 14CF71 and CS to Bayfield CO cases 568 CTS, absol, cog, aoda, couns, cc each, remanded.

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Kimberly Lawton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling SAR 14CF127 and sentencing on 14CF71.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John Richard Johnson in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2 cases. DEJ on 14Cf71 has been revoked, PSI filed. DA no corrections to PSI, has issue he wishes to raise with the court before proceeding. DA def had been Drg Ct and TAD participant, cases for sentencing today are the cases that he was in Drg ct and TAD for, uncomfortable with handling sentencing asks court to recuse itself from sentencing and intends to ask for a special prosecutor to prosecute. Atty Perrine understands DAs position would prefer to proceed are prepared to waive the conflict. Judge is going to recuse himself in each case. Does not want any reason to second guess judgment.

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF127 and 14CF71. Atty Perrine motion for entry of judgment on 14CF71. Defendant John Richard Johnson appeared by video means. DEJ on 14CF71. State has filed a motion that he has not completed. Atty Perrine acknowledges that he has not complied. Ct finds beyond a reasonable doubt that has not completed DEJ  Ct adjudges Convicted of Conspiring to Deliver Meth. Atty Perrine requests another sentencing date. State requests PSI. Ct grants request for PSI applicable on both cases.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
